comments:
We have started to see NoClassDef errors when invoking static methods on newly
created plug-ins in M6.  References to static variables appear to be working
correctly.

Example code that will fail:

String foo = OnePlugin.STATIC_STRING; //no problem here
Plugin p = OnePlugin.getDefault(); //NoClassDefError thrown here

We do not see any compile errors, nor do we see this problem with invoking
static methods on plug-ins that we created previously to starting with M4 and
earlier.  We have no data on plugins created with M5 due to other ClassLoader
issues.

Will attach a workspace that exhibits this bug in our environment.

Created an attachment (id=20891)
workspace exhibiting bug

This is a workspace created by creating two new plug-ins from templates.

Plug-in one has a view and should appear in the bottom right.  Invoking the
first action should cause this bug to manifest.

Stack trace that we have been seeing.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: two/TwoPlugin
	at one.views.SampleView$2.run(SampleView.java:156)

This is normal. The plugin two should export its classes.
To change that, go to the runtime tab of the plugin editor, click on two.jar and
select "export the entire library" in the visibility section.

I opened bug #94545 to capture what I think is a problem in the default settings.
